meta.title: Furniture retail web search trend EU
meta.description: Monthly Google Trends index for a basket of major furniture retailers across DE, FR, IT, ES and PL. Aggregated using 2025 core website visitation weights and indexed to 2018.
meta.source: Google Trends, web search interest over time, resampled to monthly (MS) weighted to 2025 core website traffic.

trend_summary_failure.last_text: The furniture retail web search trend in the EU has experienced notable fluctuations since 2018, with a peak in November 2020 at an index value of 140.9, followed by a gradual decline that reached a trough of 75.3 in June 2025. Recently, the index stands at 106.7, suggesting a stabilization above the long-run baseline of 100, although average values from 2023 onward indicate a decrease to 94.5 compared to the higher averages of 116.6 during 2020-2021. Year-over-year metrics show a slight positive momentum of 3.0% year-to-date, while the 12-month change reflects a minor decline of 0.6%, indicating mixed trends in consumer interest over the longer term.
basic_reasons: Did not reference YoY/YTD momentum metrics (prompt asked for it).

attempts.text: The furniture retail web search trend in the EU has experienced notable fluctuations since 2018, peaking in November 2020 at an index value of 140.9 before declining to a trough of 75.3 in June 2025. Currently, the index sits at 106.7, suggesting a stabilization above the long-run baseline of 100, but below the average levels observed in 2020-2021 (116.6) and the more recent average for 2023 and beyond (94.5). Recent momentum appears mixed, with year-over-year growth of 3.0% year-to-date and a slight decline of 0.6% over the past 12 months, indicating a potential shift in consumer interest.
basic_reasons: Did not reference YoY/YTD momentum metrics (prompt asked for it).

Recent momentum appears mixed, with a year-over-year increase of 3.0% and a slight decline of 0.6% over the past 12 months, indicating some variability in consumer interest.

attempts.text: The chart illustrates the monthly Google Trends index for major furniture retailers in the EU from January 2018 to January 2026, revealing distinct phases in consumer interest. A notable peak occurred in November 2020 at 140.9, followed by a gradual decline, reaching a trough of 75.3 in June 2025. Currently, the index sits at 106.7, suggesting a stabilization above the long-run baseline of 100 (indexed to 2018). Recent momentum appears mixed, with a year-over-year increase of 3.0% and a slight decline of 0.6% over the past 12 months, indicating fluctuating consumer interest in the furniture sector.
basic_reasons: Did not reference YoY/YTD momentum metrics (prompt asked for it).

reasons: The paragraph mentions a 'gradual decline' after the peak, which is misleading as it does not accurately reflect the data trend leading to the trough.
The statement about 'recent momentum appears mixed' is vague and does not clearly reference the specific year-over-year or year-to-date measures.
The paragraph does not mention the average values for 2020-2021 and 2023+, which could provide additional context.
